model:
&types; Registration User ID User ID to use for authentication
( < authname > )
Password Password to use for authentication
( < authPassword > )
Display Name Name to be used as Caller ID in SIP signaling
( < displayname > )


Registrar manual auto none manual Select manual to manually configure the registrar. Select auto to discover the SIP registrar in the network. Select none to remove the SIP registrar configuration
( < registrar > )
Registrar Address Domain name or IP address of SIP registrar
( < registrarAddress > )
Register to-address The field contains the address of record whose registration is to be created or updated
< registrarToAddress >
Register from-address The field is same as the Register to-address field except the third party registration on your behalf
< registrarFromAddress >
Use Domain Name FALSE If selected then the local domain name, obtained from DHCP or manual configuration, is used as the domain for to-address and from-address
( < registrarUsedomainName > )
Expires (sec) 3600 The field specifies the registration duration as reported to the registrar in units of seconds
( < registertimer > )


Proxy Address Domain name or IP address of outbound proxy
( < proxyAddress > )
Proxy Usage Mode noneThroughProxy forwardAllThroughProxy sendFirstInviteToProxy forwardAllThroughProxy If Proxy Address is specified and forwardAllThroughProxy option is selected, all SIP messages except REGISTER are sent through proxy. If Proxy Address is specified and sendFirstInviteToProxy option is selected, then the first INVITE is sent through proxy. If noneThroughProxy is selected only the dialed numbers and unresolved URIs go through the proxy
( < sipProxy > )
Register Through Proxy TRUE If checked and Proxy Address is specified, SIP REGISTER messages are sent through the proxy
( < registerThroughProxy > )


MWI Subscribe? TRUE If checked, the phone will send MWI (Message Waiting Indicator) subscription for MWI Req URI specified below
( < mwiSubscribe > )
MWI Req URI MWI subscription Request URI
( < mwiReqUri > )


Voicemail Access Number Number/URI to access the mailbox account
( < voiceMailServerAddress > )
PUBLISH/SIMPLE Server Address used for sending SUBSCRIBE requests for presence event
( < presenceServer > )
PUBLISH? FALSE If checked, the phone publishes the present status for this user
( < sipUsePublish > )
Conference Server URI Domain name or IP address of the conference server
( < conferenceServerAddress > )
MoH Server URI URI of Music On Hold server. If specified the music is played at the remote end when the call is placed on hold
( < mohServer > )


Call Forward Call Forward forwardonBusy forwardonNoAnswer forwardonBusyOrNoAnswer forwardAll none none If forwardonBusy is selected, all the calls will be forwarded to Call Forward Address when the phone is busy. If forwardonNoAnswer is selected, all the calls will be forwarded to Call Forward Address if they are not answered within the time specified in CFNA timer. If forwardonBusyOrNoAnswer is selected, all the calls will be forwarded to Call Forward Address when the phone is busy or does not answer the calls within the time specified in CFNA timer. Select none to disable the call forwarding
( < callForwardMode > )
Call Forward Address Destination number or URI to forward the calls
( < callForwardAddress > )
CFNA Timer 20 40 60 20 Call forward on no answer timer in seconds
( < callForwardTimer > )


Call Park Call Park Method Ask for Orbit none One Touch Park Orbit prefix Incall DTMF incall DTMF none If Ask for Orbit is selected the phone will prompt to dial a park orbit when the PARK softkey is pressed. If One Touch Park Orbit or Incall DTMF is selected, the phone will park the call automatically to the orbit specified in One Touch Park Orbit field specified below. To use the Incall DTMF call park method the server must support the Incall DTMF call parking
( < callParkMethod > )
One Touch Park Orbit One touch park orbit or incall DTMF string
( < callParkExtention > )
Call Retrieve Prefix Prefix to the extension dialed to retrieve the parked calls
( < callRtrvPrefix > )


Call Pickup Server Assisted Call PickUp FALSE If checked then the phone uses the Call PickUp Prefix to pick up a ringing extension
( < serverAssistCallPickup > )
Call PickUp Prefix Prefix used for Call Pickup
( < callPickupPrefix > )


Intercom Intercom Invocation callInfoHeader alertInfoHeader intercomPrefix callInfoHeader If callInfoHeader is selected, the phone sends Call-Info header in INVITE for intercom. If alertInfoHeader is selected, the phone sends Alert-Info header in INVITE for intercom. If intercomPrefix is selected, phone uses the Intercom Prefix Value for Intercom invocation
( < intercom > )
Intercom Prefix Value Prefix used for Intercom invocation
( < intercomPrefixValue > )
Alert-Info Secret This value is compared with the secret that comes in Alert-Info header of incoming INVITE. Intercom call starts if the secret matches with this value
( < alertInfoSecret > )
sendrecv attribute in outgoing intercom FALSE If checked, sendrecv direction attribute will be sent in SDP of outgoing INVITE for intercom
If unchecked send only direction attribute is sent
( < sendrecvInOutgoingIntercom > )


Group Paging Prefix Prefix used to page a group of extensions
( < groupPagingPrefix > )
SIP Settings SIP Port The port at which you wish the other party to contact you
( < sipPort > )
Offhook on Third-Party Refer FALSE If checked, the phone automatically goes offhook when it receives a third-party REFER request. This is for situations where the user initiates a call from third-party device, such as PC-based soft phones or click-to-talk feature, but then wants the phone to go offhook and actually place the call
( < offhookOnRefer > )
Use Preloaded Route FALSE If checked, a SIP Route: header is added in outgoing messages to request the outbound proxy to be included in all return paths
( < usePreloadedRoute > )
Block Caller ID FALSE If checked, this prevents your Caller ID from being shown to other party
( < callerIdBlocking > )


Incoming Invite PAId-From-Contact PAId-Contact-From PAId-From-Contact Caller Name Search Precedence in Incoming Invite
( < incomingInvite > )
200 OK of Invite PAId-Contact-To PAId-To-Contact PAId-Contact-To Caller Name Search Precedence in 200 OK of Invite
( < okOfInvite > )
SIP Security SIP TLS Port The SIP TLS port at which you wish the other party to contact you
( < tlsPort > )
Enable SIP TLS Security FALSE If checked, this will enable SIP TLS security for this line
( < enableTlsSecurity > )


TLS Client Certificate Url TLS Client Certificate HTTPS/HTTP Url
( < tlsClientCertificateUrl > )
TLS Client Key Url TLS Client Key HTTPS/HTTP Url
( < tlsClientKeyUrl > )
TLS CA Certificate Url TLS CA Certificate HTTPS/HTTP Url
( < tlsCaCertificateUrl > )
RTP Settings RTP Port Starting RTP port for this line
( < rtpPort > )
Transmit DTMF info inband rfc2833 rfc2833 If info is selected, SIP INFO DTMF as defined in IETF RFC 2976 will be used. If inband is selected, in-band DTMF as audio is used. If rfc2833 is selected, DTMF is injected into the RTP stream as defined in IETF RFC 2833
( < transmitDtmf > )
Preferred Codec g711ulaw g711alaw g729 g711ulaw Preference for audio codec that the phone uses in SDP offer
( < preferredCodec > )
Tone Settings Enable Routing Tone TRUE If checked, a routing tone is played for the brief interval between placing a call and remote end starts ringing
( < enableRoutingTone > )
Tone Set US/Canada United Kingdom Australia US/Canada Country specific tones
( < toneSet > )
Miscellaneous Settings NAT Address If you have a NAT/Firewall that you want to traverse, specify its WAN, or outside, IP address
( < natAddress > )
Dial Plan When dial plan is present, number-only dialing during the making of the new calls will be compared against the dial plan patterns and if a match is found, then the call will be initiated automatically without pressing the DIAL
( < sipDialplan > )
Disable FLASH Key During Calls FALSE Disabling FLASH key during calls allows other methods of getting a second dial tone. Selecting RFC 2833 as transmit-DTMF method causes the telephone to simply transmit the RFC 2833 FLASH event instead of pressing this key internally
( < disableCall1_2key > )
Auto Dial FALSE If checked, the Auto Dial User ID gets dialed without any need to enter a number as soon as the handset is picked up or SPEAKER or HEADSET button is pressed
( < sipAutoDial > )
Auto Dial User ID User ID to be dialed automatically
( < sipAutoDialUserid > )
Disable Call Waiting FALSE If checked, Call Waiting will be disabled so that the phone immediatley rejects an incoming call if there is already an active call on this line
( < disableCallWaiting > )
Disable Star Codes FALSE Disabling call feature codes causes the phone to not process and to instead pass through all key presses for star feature codes, e.g., *67, *69, *70 and *99, for downstream processing
( < disableStarCodes > )
Use only UDP SRV FALSE If checked, phone only use UDP SRV search in order to limit the extent of DNS name resolution searches
( < useOnlyUdpSrv > )
